newsitem.title: USA: AmeriNet names Eric Cunliffe president.
newsitem.headline: AmeriNet names Eric Cunliffe president.

text.p: AmeriNet Financial Systems Inc said Tuesday it has promoted Eric Cunliffe to the position of president and chief operating officer.
Cunliffe was previously executive vice president of the company's National Transaction Center in Denver.

"Mr. Cunliffe has extensive business experience in establishing and managing 'affinity' type business relationships," said John Pembroke, chairman and chief executive. "AmeriNet is about to launch a real estate referral and mortgage services program with a national affinity organization. We want to give Mr. Cunliffe full authority to use his expertise for the benefit of the affinity membership."
AmeriNet also promoted William Yeager, a founder of AmeriNet, to the position of chief financial officer.
The company was not immediately available for further comment.
